mdRecord.dcterms:title: U.S. Army nurse's uniform from World War II
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This uniform was worn by Ruth Eastman, a nurse in the U.S. Army 8th Evacuation Hospital unit, during World War II. The uniform consists of a tan jacket and skirt: jacket with gold buttons and brown trim and (3) patches: blue and white, red white and blue "A5", 4 gold bars; "Ruth A. Eastman" sewn into collar; skirt with "Ruth A. Eastman" in two places and "SBHolars T-3" sewn/tacked onto inner lining.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Uniforms
World War, 1939-1945
United States. Army. Evacuation Hospital, 8th
